p: The developed SNEDDS formulations showed a high solubility and dissolution profile of TAL in the anhydrous, 99% diluted formulations and maintained solubilized TAL mostly in aqueous phase of the digested samples in vitro. The gut permeability and oral bioavailability of the representative SNEDDS formulation was found to increase by 4- and 1.58-fold when compared to pure raw drug, respectively. The overall results conclude that LFCS Type IIIB lipid-based SNEDDS can be explored as a potential vehicle to obtain higher drug loading, improved dissolution, digestion, permeation and enhanced bioavailability of the poorly soluble drug, TAL with no toxic effects.
